name: Observer and the Observed
description:
Observer and the Observed

is a short tale about a mysterious house in the woods. According to the locals, the owner would offer visitors highly intriguing tapes, and that guests are guaranteed to leave with a great deal of insight into their own lives.

CONTENT WARNING [SPOILER] You might find the theme disturbing. Jam

Observer and the Observed was made in 5 days for the Wanderjahre Game Jam 3. The game follows two restrictions: No Text and Anagnorisis, which means the character has a moment of discovery that recontextualizes the narrative. Overall, this was a very challenging set of restrictions and I'm curious to know if you think I'm successful in delivering the anagnorisis.

Playing with the native build instead of the web version is highly recommended if you are experiencing performance issues.

Inspiration

The story for this jam entry is heavily inspired by the manga Soumatoh Kabushikigaishac by Sugawara Keita, also known by its English name, Revolving Lantern Corporation. The episodic manga tells the story of a company that offers customers DVDs containing a recording of their own life. These DVDs are in their perspective, often from birth to death. I ended up binging the 10 volumes of the manga over New Years and wanted to try my hand at making a short story with the same premise.
